title: Human donor
description: Schema for submitting a human donor.
comment: This object type is abstract. These properties are inherited by other object types

items.title: Alternate accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

ancestry_method.title: Ancestry method
ancestry_method.description: The method used to determine the ancestry of the donor.

ancestry.title: Ancestry
ancestry.description: Ancestry of the donor, as determined by genotype.

ancestry_group.description: An ancestry group, preferably defined by the Human Ancestry Ontology.

fraction.description: An estimated proportion ancestry to the corresponding group, as determined by genotype data.

ethnicity.title: Ethnicity
ethnicity.description: Ethnic group(s) to which the donor belongs, usually self-reported by the donor.

living_at_sample_collection.title: Living at sample collection
living_at_sample_collection.description: If true, the donor was alive at the time of sample collection.

reported_ethnicity.title: Reported ethnicity
reported_ethnicity.description: Free text value recorded as the ethnic group to which the donor belongs.
reported_ethnicity.comment: Only adjusted from researcher's records by capitalization, correcting typos, or removing odd characters.

family_medical_history.title: Family medical history
family_medical_history.description: A list of known conditions present in the donor's family and details of that history.

present.title: Present
present.description: If the disease or condition has been present in the donor's family.

family_members.title: Family members
family_members.description: The donor's family members known to have that disease or condition.

parents.title: Parents
parents.comment: This is a link for cases when families are all donors in our system. Children will be calculated from this link.

siblings.title: Siblings
siblings.description: Donors that have at least one parent in common with this donor.
siblings.comment: This is a link for cases when families are all donors in our system.

items.title: Sibling
items.description: A donor that has at least one parent in common.

twin.title: Twin
twin.description: A human donor that is a twin sibling of this human donor.

phenotype.title: Phenotype
phenotype.description: Any condition not included in MONDO, or additional histological, spatial, or disease subtype notes about diseases included in the 'disease' field.
